messages.content: 9-1-1, what's your emergency?
Hello, 911? Please help me. Somebody's trying to get into my house.
What are they doing?
They tied my front door and my shed door, and now they're trying to break in through my gate.
Okay, stay on the line with me. I've already got officers started. Do not hang up, okay?
All right, I have a gun in my hands. I'm terrified.
Okay, I've got officers already on the way. I'm going to keep you on the phone until the officers get there, okay?
Okay. They're trying the back gate now.
You think they're in the back now?
Yes, somebody's in the back and on my porch.
Someone's on your porch? Please stay calm. Can you see anybody?
I hear them, but I'm not sure. Somebody's banging on my back door.
Are you expecting anybody?
No.
Okay. There's no vehicle outside in your driveway?
No, and they're at my back porch.
Okay, I'm going to stay on the phone with you until the officers get there. Do not hang up. A lot of officers are coming out.
They just broke my upstairs door.
Okay, I've got officers coming out as fast as they can. Have you heard any voices?
They're coming in right now.
Okay, tell me if you see them. Tell me what they look like, how many of them are there, whether they're men or women.
I just saw one.
Did you see a person or just the shadow?
I saw someone. They're coming in right now, please, please.
They're coming out as fast as they can, I promise you. A lot of officers are responding. I'm typing everything you're telling me and the dispatcher is relaying it to them immediately.
They're breaking my windows.
Are you in your bedroom or...?
I'm in my bathroom.
Okay, they're coming out as fast as they can. Is there an alley behind your house?
Yes.
Okay, so you back up to the canal, right?
Yes.
You don't need to answer anything. I'm going to stay on the line with you, okay?
What is that? What was that?
What happened?
What did you come into my house for? I don't know. I shot him.
You shot him?
Yeah.
Okay, I've got help on the way.
I'm sorry. Don't get up or I'll shoot you again.
Where did you shoot him? Ma'am, where did you shoot him?
He's in my bathroom.
No, where on his body did you shoot him?
He's half in my bathroom and half in the hallway.
Do you recognize him? Is he someone you know?
No, I don't recognize him. He said he thought the house was abandoned.
It doesn't make sense with a car and locked gates, right?
Yes, he was banging and trying to get in. I heard him outside.
Okay. The officers are on their way. Please stay calm.
Please get someone here quickly.
They're coming as fast as they can. Are you hurt at all?
My face is bleeding. He was beating on me when he found out I was in here. That's why I dropped the phone and almost dropped the gun.
Okay. The officers are in the area now. When you hear them at the door, you're going to have to stay safe. Don't leave the bathroom.
I'm not going to walk away from this guy.
Right, I'm going to have them come to you. Just make sure to put the gun down when you see the officers, okay?
Okay.
I'm showing they are there. They should be coming inside.
Okay, I put the gun down.
Alright, I'm going to let you go now, okay?
Okay. Bye-bye.
